co.cask.coopr.scheduler.dag

Class TaskDag

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.coopr.scheduler.dag.TaskDag

  • public class TaskDag
extends Object
    A DAG (directed acyclic graph) to linearize a set of dependent tasks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TaskDag() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDependency(TaskNode fromNode, TaskNode toNode)
      Defines a dependency between task fromNode to toNode.
      void addTaskNode(TaskNode node)
      Add a node without any edges, meaning nothing depends on this node (yet).
      boolean equals(Object o) 
      int hashCode() 
      List<Set<TaskNode>> linearize()
      Linearize the DAG into a list of stages, where each stage is a set of tasks that can be executed in parallel, and where each task in a stage can only be executed once all the tasks in the previous stage have successfully completed.
      String toString()

      • TaskDag

        public TaskDag()

    • Method Detail

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(TaskNode fromNode,
                 TaskNode toNode)
        Defines a dependency between task fromNode to toNode.
        Parameters:
        fromNode - task that the toNode depends on.
        toNode - task that depends on the fromNode.

      • addTaskNode

        public void addTaskNode(TaskNode node)
        Add a node without any edges, meaning nothing depends on this node (yet).
        Parameters:
        node - task to add to the DAG.

      • linearize

        public List<Set<TaskNode>> linearize()
        Linearize the DAG into a list of stages, where each stage is a set of tasks that can be executed in parallel, and where each task in a stage can only be executed once all the tasks in the previous stage have successfully completed.
        Returns:
        a list of set of actions that can be performed in order satisfying the dependencies. The actions in each set can be run in parallel.
